item.title: Margarita add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Samuel Taylor Coleridge
item.description: "Readers may be divided into four classes: 1) Sponges, who absorb all that they read and return it in nearly the same state, only a little dirtied. 2) Sand-glasses, who retain nothing and are content to get through a book for the sake of getting through the time. 3) Strain-bags, who retain merely the dregs of what they read. 4) Mogul diamonds, equally rare and valuable, who profit by what they read, and enable others to profit by it also" -- Samuel Taylor Coleridge

item.title: Margarita add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Don't say you don't have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Pasteur, Michaelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson, and Albert Einstein." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?" -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "If you make a mistake and do not correct it, this is called a mistake." -- Confucius

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "A hero is no braver than an ordinary man, but he is brave five minutes longer." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Bruce Springsteen
item.description: "Someday we'll look back on this and it will all seem funny." -- Bruce Springsteen

item.title: Margarita add a quote by robert harris
item.description: "To say she was my girlfriend was absurd: no one the wrong side of thirty has a girlfriend… I suppose I ought to have realize it’s ominous that forty thousand years of human language had failed to produce a word for our relationship." -- robert harris

item.title: Margarita add a quote by steven wright
item.description: "If it's a penny for your thoughts and you put in your two cents worth, then someone, somewhere is making a penny." -- steven wright

item.title: Margarita add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. No use being a damn fool about it." -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Henri Frederic Amiel
item.description: "Life is short. Be swift to love! Make haste to be kind!" -- Henri Frederic Amiel

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "There is no one, no matter how wise he is, who has not in his youth said things or done things that are so unpleasant to recall in later life that he would expunge them entirely from his memory if that were possible." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Fannie Hurst
item.description: "Some people think they are worth a lot of money just because they have it." -- Fannie Hurst

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Sarah Rees Brennan
item.description: "Once you start thinking about the lies people tell when they don't know they're telling them, the truths people reveal when they think they're lying, then you can start to build a world." -- Sarah Rees Brennan

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Mignon McLaughlin
item.description: "Don't be yourself. Be someone a little nicer." -- Mignon McLaughlin

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Charles Caleb Colton
item.description: "Our admiration of fine writing will always be in proportion to its real difficulty and its apparent ease." -- Charles Caleb Colton

item.title: Margarita add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle." -- Plato
